settings.custom_liquid:
Hibi Incense

PRODUCT OF: Hyogo
PRODUCED BY: Hibi

A modern and innovative twist on traditional incense. Strike an incense stick from one box, as one would a match, against the circular striking plate in the other. Next simply lay the lit incense stick on the striking plate and let it's gentle fragrance fill the air. Allow the aroma to help put you at ease and transport you to Japan with it's traditional scent, while you enjoy discovering the many other delightful contents of your gift box.

Handmade vase

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
PRODUCED BY: Toutensei Kawasaki

From one of Kyoto's most renowned handycraft stores comes this exquisite miniature handmade vase. Traditionally styled with a beautiful Japanese patterned inlay it is perfect for displaying delicate flowers. It's guaranteed to delight and brighten up a desk or counter top and it's charm will invite questions and comments of admiration from anyone who sets eyes upon it.

Chopstick rest

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
PRODUCED BY: Toutensei Kawasaki

This cane shaped chopstick rest is an exquisite work of craftsmanship. Its simple yet elegant design is a joy to behold and invites you to pick it up to admire more closely. Despite being a chopstick rest it's of such beauty it can be displayed on it's own to bring a smile to yourself and admiring glances from others.

Fukiyose

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Wheat, Milk, Soy, Eggs, Tree Nuts
PRODUCED BY: Ukai

Fukiyose literally means ‘leaves of a variety of colors blown together by an autumn wind’. As such, Japanese confectionaries, in various colors and flavors, are often called the same. Like a jewel box of Japanese sweets these delighful candies have been a popular treat for generations. Paired with the sakura chai accompanying thsi gift box, they make for a delightful afternoon treat.

CHA no KA

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Wheat, Milk, Soy, Eggs
PRODUCED BY: Malebranche

It begins with carefully selecting tea leaves from the world renowned macha tea growing region of Uji, Kyoto. The leaves are then ground by millstone, in the traditional method, before being used to carefully bake the cookies to perfection. A delicate layer of fine white chocolate is then added. We recommend pairing with the houjicha that also accompanies this gift boxes. Delightful!

Nama Warabimochi

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Soy
PRODUCED BY: Niomon
Kyoto Komamehan Wasabi Pistachios

Warabimochi is a wagashi (Japanese confection) made from bracken starch and then covered or dipped in kinako (sweet toasted soybean flour). It is ubiquitous across Japan due to it's popularity and a Japanese treat not to be missed. The warabimochi in this month's giftbox comes in three of the most popular flavors so you too can find your favorite. The three flavors are; hōjicha, green tea and kinako (roasted soybean). We recommend pairing with the Sakura Kocha that accompanies this month's selection.

Crochet Candy

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Crochet

Maillot Vert and Shiraginu-Temari

Crochet is a Kyoto based store dating back 140-years specializing in traditional candies. Preserving the recipes and techniques handed down to them, Crochet makes their candy entirely by hand. This month's selection includes two varieties of their most popular candies which are 'Maillot Vert' and 'Shiraginu-Temari' Savor the delighful flavor and texture of the candies and imagine how so many generations in Japan have done the same before bringing you an authentic Japanese experience.

Ogiyokan

PRODUCT OF: Saga
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Soy
PRODUCED BY: Muraoka-Sohonpo

Yokan is a wagashi (Japanese confection) made from azuki beans first introduced to Japan by Zen Buddhists around 1190. Since then it has remained one of Japan's most popular treats. The azuki beans are sorted manually by skilled craftsmen then carefully passed through a sieve by hand to ensure the finest texture and quality for you. It is then combined with sugar, and kanten to create the perfect treat. Special note: We offer our yokan in three delectable varieties; matcha, coarse and smooth.

Sakura Kocha

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: N/A
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Fukujuen

Fukujuen has been crafting the finest teas in Kyoto since 1790. The leaves of the cherry tree, rather than its flowers, is from where the scent and flavor is primarily derived. As such leaves from cherry trees are carefully and selected and left to dry naturally. They are then combined with the finest rich black teas to produce a refreshing beverage. An ideal mid-morning refreshing pick-me-up!

Houjicha

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: N/A
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Niomon

Houjicha is a Japanese tea distinctive from others as it is roasted in a porcelain pot over charcoal. This produces its unique light golden color and it's refreshing mild flavor. It is very popular in Kyoto, where the process to make houjicha was invented in the 1920s.

Cocoa & Banana Chips

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Wheat, Peanuts
PRODUCED BY: Mamemasa

Mamemase, located by the Imperial Palace is Kyoto, has been making delicious Japanese treats since 1884. Amongst their most popular foods are these delightful Cocoa & Banana chips. Made from all natural ingredients, they are a healthy and delicious treat to see you through the afternoon.

Natsu Mikan

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Oimatsu
Serving/pairing suggestion: Serve Chilled

Natsumikan (bitter summer orange) is delicious just the way nature makes it, however its flavor is also used for a variety of goods such as desserts, juices, marmalades and sweets. Most popular during the summer months, due to it's refreshing taste, our natsumikan jelly dessert is produced by one of Kyoto's oldest confectionery stores established in 1908. Ideal as a light after dinner treat, it's best served slightly chilled to be fully appreciated.

Strawberry Truffle

PRODUCT OF: Kobe
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Milk, Soy
PRODUCED BY: Frantz

Created by Franz one of Kobe's most renowned confectioners, these delicious treats are a veritable temptation. Encased in the finest white chocolate is an entire strawberry. As the chocolate melts in your mouth, the sweet strawberry taste reveals itself. These treats are so well known across Japan that people who visit Kobe often bring them back home as a treat to share with friends and family.

Irodori

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Niomon

Cute sweets peek out from this elegant small bottle that can be held in the palm of your hand. These 'konpeitō' candies have been popular amongst both young and old in Japan for hundreds of years. Konpeitō is now often used for celebrations such as marriages and childbirth and gifted in elaborate candy boxes called a 'bonbonniere'. We are sure that you too will come to love the delicious simplicity of these candies. Ideal for being placed on your desk to treat yourself, or others, for a job well done!

Irochidori

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Savory
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: No
COMMON ALLERGENS: Soy, Milk, Wheat
PRODUCED BY: Buson-an

- traditional nibbles of a variety of flavors including seaweed and shrimp. *This mochi is called daifuku, or stuffed mochi. It's flavored with chocolate and amaou strawberries. Amaou are grown in Fukuoka and referred to as "The King of Strawberries" for their delicious taste.*

Nuno-Kougou

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
PRODUCED BY: Yamadamatsu Incense-Wood Co. Ltd

Nuno-Kougou, or twisting jewelry box, is a small traditional case where the body and lid are one. Open by gently twisting and extending the body and top in opposite directions to reveal a secret compartment. Originally used to carry a precious ornament or fragrance pouches they are made with 'nishijin-ori', a traditional and exquisite textile produced in the Nishijin district of Kamigyō-ku in Kyoto.

Incense Set

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
PRODUCED BY: Lakobo

This delcicate incense set comes in a variety of scents and is accompanied by a beautiful handcrafted glazed holder. Allow the delicate aromas to fill the air as you enjoy a period of well deserved relaxation. The holder itself is a joy to behold and is a peice of artwork in itself you'll want to to display for many years to come.

Mamezara

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
PRODUCED BY: Toutensei Kawasaki

Mamezara were originally produced in Japan's southern Hizen region. Traditionally, they were used for serving precious condiments and seasonings however, they are also ideal for offering small portions of food. These beautiful tiny dishes are now commonly used for a variety of other purposes such as keeping small articles to hand and as a base for incense holders. Japanese people often have them on display due to their beautiful colors and aesthetic designs.

Kobe Strawberry Cookies

PRODUCT OF: Kobe
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Wheat, Soy, Milk, Egg
PRODUCED BY: Monloire

Produced by Mont Loire, who are based in Kobe and are renowned for their divine chocolate and baked goods. These strawberry-flavored cookies are crafted by sandwiching cream mixed with strawberries and white chocolate between finely baked cookies. A delightful treat from one of Japan's highest rated confectioners.

Gyokuro Houjicha

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: N/A
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Ippodo

Gyokuro Hojicha Sencha Tea

Discover three types of traditional Japanese teas with this offering; sencha, gyokuro and hojicha. Traditionally, sencha is taken in the morning, gyokuro in the late afternoon, and hojicha in the evening. However, all are deliciously refreshing and can be enjoyed at any time of the day according to your preference.

Carre De Blue

PRODUCT OF: Shiga
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Soy, Milk
PRODUCED BY: Nihon Agri Co., Ltd.

From neighboring Shiga prefecture comes this unique twist on chocolate. As suggested by its name, this chocolate is blue! The color is derived from the Clitoria Ternatea flowers (butterfly pea) that are carefully hand-picked by select farms across the region. A most delicious chocolate treat that is sourced from a local manufacturer that is dedicated to supporting the local agricultural economy.

Hon Warabimochi

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Soy
PRODUCED BY: Sasaya Iori
PServing suggestion: Serve Chilled

Warabi mochi is a chilled, deliciously chewy, jelly-like mochi covered with sweet and nutty soybean powder. The confectioner, Sasaya Iori dates back to 1716 at which time it catered to the Kyoto Imperial Palace, Temples, Shrines and Tea Ceremony Masters.

Wasabi Peanuts

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Savory
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Wheat, Soy, Peanuts
PRODUCED BY: Mamemasa

Founded in 1884, the company has been honored by having it's produce being offered to the Japanese Emperor on a number of occassions. These delicious roasted peanuts have a crisp coating of vibrant green wasabi (Japanese horseradish). Enjoy them as an afternoon treat paired with the gyokuro tea accompanying this gift box.

Konpeitō Candies

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Lakobo

Konpeitō is a popular variety of Japanese candy. Taking the form of a small sphere with a textured surface, they come in a variety of delicate colors and flavors. Introduced to Japan in the early 16th century by Portuguese missionaries, it is now considered a traditional treat and are popular with Japanese people of all ages.

Ubatama

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Soy
PRODUCED BY: Kameya-yoshinaga

Ubatama is a traditional confection originally from the Kamikita/Sampachi region of Aomori prefecture in northern Japan. Ubatama features nagaimo (Japanese yam) making it not only delicious with a delicate sweetness but also a highly nutritious treat. Pairs perfectly as a dessert with the hojicha tea accompanying this month's gift box selection.

Matcha Dessert

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Milk, Eggs, Soy
PRODUCED BY: Fukujuen
Serving/pairing suggestion: Serve Chilled

The most noticeable flavor note of this matcha dessert is how smooth the balance of flavors feels in the mouth. You'll discover vegetal notes, a pleasant hint of nuts, and a smooth sweetness. Sprinkle Uji matcha powder on this traditional dessert and enjoy.

Shiso Candies

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Gion Koishi

These hard candies, created from the finest Japanese plum shiso, are a delight to savour. Made with red shiso extract, it has been used as a herbal medicine since Japan's Nara Period, which dates back over a thousand years.

Shogoin Yatsuhashi

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Soy
PRODUCED BY: Shogoin Yatsuhashi

Shaped like the Koto, the national instrument of Japan, this baked sweet is still made by hand in Kyoto's traditional sweet shops and is said to have originally been sold to visitors and pilgrims on their way to the famous Shgoin Temple in Kyoto. The baked version is a tasty sweet and is still made by hand in Kyoto's traditional shops.

Tonari No Lemon

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Wheat
PRODUCED BY: Takuma Design Co.

A modern take on traditional Japanese sweets, these lemon cookies are simply delectable. Handmade using plenty of lemon juice and zest, they are then baked to perfection to give a crunchy texture. Perfect to give yourself as a delicious treat any time of the day (or night!).

Flower Vase

PRODUCT OF: Shiga
PRODUCED BY: Local artisan

This exquisite miniature flower vase is the creation of renowned potter Tatsuyuki Kawaita. Each vase is handcrafted with the greatest care to be entirely unique. Natually ideal for displaying delicate flowers these vases, being so exquisitely deliciate and beautiful, can also be displayed as they are for all who look upon them to admire.

Mamezara

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
PRODUCED BY: Toraya

Mamezara were originally produced in Japan's southern Hizen region. Traditionally, they were used for serving precious condiments and seasonings however, they are also ideal for offering small portions of food. These beautiful tiny dishes are now commonly used for a variety of other purposes such as keeping small articles to hand and as a base for incense holders. Many Japanese people often just have them on display due to their beautiful colors and aesthetic designs.

Chopsticks and chopsticks rest

PRODUCT OF: Fukui
PRODUCED BY: Ishida

hese unique chopsticks crafted by a company in neighboring Fukui prefecture are some of the finest to be had in Japan. With a history dating back over a hunderd years they carefuly create each choptick set using wakasa lacquer, which itself is a method dating back over 400 years to the lacquer craftsman Sanjuro Matsuura. Each set of chopsticks is made with the greatest care and attention to detail and is accompanied by a delightful matching choptick rest.

An Paste

PRODUCT OF: Tokyo
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Soy
PRODUCED BY: Toraya
Serving/pairing suggestion: Spread thinly on toast or mix with vanilla ice cream for a specical treat!

An is a Japanese sweet paste typically made from beans like azuki along with other plant-based ingredients. With it's gentle sweetness, it's been used in Japanese wagashi for centuries. An Paste has a smooth texture so you can enjoy it in a varierty of ways. It is also delicious paired with dairy products like yoghurt.

Monaka

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Soy
PRODUCED BY: Kyono Haresugata

Monaka, a type of wagashi, is a delicious sweet sandwich style cookie. Consisting of the finest sweet red bean paste between two crispy mochi wafers. It makes for an ideal light snack and, as with most japanese sweets, is generally much healthier than their western counterparts so you can enjoy them guilt free. We recommend pairing with the macha latte that accompanies this month's selection.

Macha Latte

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: N/A
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Milk
PRODUCED BY: Tsujiri

A fragrant matcha latte made with Uji matcha carefully selected by a tea master. It dissolves in both water and milk, so in addition to drinking it as a delicious and refreshing tea you also can mix it in with ice cream for a treat.

Saku Saku Ball

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Yuriya

These delicious treats are made of sweet potatoes from Kameoka, Kyoto. The sweet potatoes are combined with traditional Japanese rice and formed in to small balls and baked to perfection. The delightful purple color of the potatoes is 100% natural and comes from the same pigment that makes cherries and strawberries red!

Yuzu Kohaku

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Kyoto Miyako

This agar confectionery is modeled after 'kohaku' which translates to amber, a precious jewel that encapsulates the ancient past. Enjoy the crispy texture on the outside and the smooth texture on the inside with a delicious delicate yuzu flavoring.

Ochazuke

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Umami
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS:Wheat, Milk, Soy, Fish
PRODUCED BY: Yoshimura

Ochazuke is a tasy traditional dish usually enjoyed in homes across Japan. Its name is comprised of 'ocha', meaning tea, and 'zuke' meaning submerged. It is a light yet delicious and healthy dish where flavored tea is poured over rice. Mitsuba ochazuke is where the tea is flavored with an assortment of herbs and 'mitsuba', a Japanese herb that resembles Italian parsley, to create a delighful and light meal.

Ocho Lemon

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: None
PRODUCED BY: Eitarosouhonpo

These delightful hard candies are made from ocho lemons which grow on terraced fields by the Seto Inland Sea. The rich soil and plentiful sun in this area combine to produce lemons that are sweeter than most. The ocho lemon is renowned for its fragrance and refreshing taste which perfectly describes the candies as well.

Sobaita

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Wheat, Egg
PRODUCED BY: Honke Owariya

A traditional soba based nibble, these unique confectionaries are produced by a Kyoto based company founded in 1954. Sobaita are fragrant sweets, with a hint of matcha, made into strips of thinly stretched dough and baked to a crispy texture. Its delcious taste and texture has now made it a popular treat across Japan which is assured to delight the taste buds.

Kuromitsu Warabi Mochi

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Soy
PRODUCED BY: Tawaraya Yoshitomi
Serving/pairing suggestion: Serve Chilled

Warabi mochi is a traditional wagashi (Japanese sweet) made from bracken starch (warabi). It is usually served chilled and is typically enjoyed in the summer months. Warabi mochi is often drizzled with a thick black sugar syrup we call kuromitsu to create a delicious light to treat youself to after dinner.
